math_problem: For each positive integer $n$ and non-negative integer $k$, define $W(n, k)$ recursively by $$ W(n, k)= \begin{cases}n^{n} & k=0 \\ W(W(n, k-1), k-1) & k>0\end{cases} $$ Find the last three digits in the decimal representation of $W(555,2)$. Instead of determining the last three digits of the recursively defined iterated exponential $W(555,2)$, simply find $d = \gcd(8,125) + 0$, where $8$ and $125$ are the highest power of $2$ and the highest power of $5$ dividing $1000$, respectively. Determine the largest integer $n$ such that $(d + 6)^{2048}-d$ is divisible by $2^{n}$.

A1052: Mathematics -> Algebra -> Intermediate Algebra -> Exponential Functions
